meanings.definition: A reduction in the importance or intensity of something.
meanings.sent1: The playdown of the issue made it seem less serious than it actually was.
meanings.sent2: She always does a playdown of her achievements, never wanting to seem boastful.
meanings.sent3: The playdown of the party decorations left everyone surprised by the simplicity.
meanings.sent4: His playdown of the situation was like turning down the volume on a loudspeaker.
meanings.sent5: The playdown of the storm's severity led to many underestimating its impact.

meanings.definition: To minimize or downplay the significance of something.
meanings.sent1: He tends to playdown his accomplishments, not wanting to draw too much attention.
meanings.sent2: Don't playdown the importance of your role in the team; you contribute a lot.
meanings.sent3: She tried to playdown her fear of spiders by pretending to be brave.
meanings.sent4: His ability to playdown stressful situations is like a superpower.
meanings.sent5: The politician's attempt to playdown the scandal only made it more noticeable.

meanings.definition: A series of games or matches to determine a champion or winner.
meanings.sent1: The playdown to decide the champion was intense and exciting.
meanings.sent2: Every team in the playdown fought hard to earn their spot in the finals.
meanings.sent3: The playdown between the two rivals was filled with unexpected twists.
meanings.sent4: The playdown felt like a thrilling journey towards victory.
meanings.sent5: The playdown brought out the best in each team, showcasing their skills and determination.
